occsphere.head: Occupation, Sphere of Activity
occsphere.p: Peter Baillie was born in 1889, the son of Rev John Baillie, Free Church Minister of Gairloch, and his wife Annie Macpherson. He was educated at Inverness Royal Academy and then at George Watson's College. Entering Edinburgh University in 1907, he graduated with a M.B., Ch.B. in 1912. For many years he was a member of the Philomathic Society and became its President in 1911.

He was senior house surgeon at Mildmay Mission Hospital, London, for six months and in January 1914 he left Britain for Jalna, India, taking up a post to which he had been appointed by the Foreign Mission Committee of the United Free Church. He was ordained as a missionary elder of Langside Hill United Free Church, Glasgow, prior to his departure. On 16 May 1914, some time after arriving in India, Peter attended a language course at Mahableshwar, where he was the victim of an accidental drowning.

relships.head: Relationships
relships.p: Peter Baillie's father was John Baillie, Free Church Minister at Gairloch. One brother was John Baillie (1886-1960), the internationally reknowned theologian, the other, Donald Macpherson Brother was Chair of Systematic Theology at the University of St. Andrews. His cousin was Sir Duncan Colvin Baillie (1856-1919), colonial administrator.

honqual.head: Honours, Qualifications and Appointments
honqual.p: 1911: President of the Philomatic Society, University of Edinburgh
1913: Senior House Surgeon, Mildmay Mission Hospital, London
